title: Blox Fruits Trading: Where & How to Trade

steps.title: Go to the Café or Mansion.
steps.content: Go to the Café or Mansion. The Café is in the Second Sea, and the Mansion is in the Third Sea.

steps.title: Sit down at a table.
steps.content: Sit down at a table. Your friend or the person you're trading with needs to sit down across from you.

steps.title: Select the item you want to trade from the pop-up.
steps.content: Select the item you want to trade from the pop-up. Your trade is on the left, and their trade is on the right side of the window. The items being traded cannot have a value difference of more than 40%. You'll see red text at the bottom if the difference in value is too much.

steps.title: Click Accept.
steps.content: Click Accept . If you like the trade, click Accept to exchange your item for the other players' item. [1] X Research source

steps.title: You can trade 5 times every 8 hours.
steps.content: You can trade 5 times every 8 hours. This number was lower in previous patches, but a newer patch updated the frequency.

steps.title: These are the trades to look out for:
steps.content: These are the trades to look out for: S+ Tier Mythical Fruits: Kitsune (PVP potential, but pricey), Dragon (great for PVP, but pricey). S Tier Mythical Fruits: Leopard (best fruit overall, but pricey), Dough (great for PVP and good grinding benefits, high value). A+ Tier Mythical Fruits: Spirit (versatile, good in PVP), Venom (powerful passives, great for PVP, PVE, raids, grinding, sea event hunting), T-Rex (good damage over time). A Tier Mythical Fruits: Control (very different mechanics, for skilled players), Mammoth (versatile, overpowered damage reduction). A- Tier Mythical Fruits: Shadow (high damage, mediocre healing). D Tier Mythical Fruits: Gravity (decent damage, underpriced) S Tier Legendary Fruits: Buddha (best for grinding, big hitbox). A+ Tier Legendary Fruits: Portal (best for fruit hunting and avoiding bounty hunters). A Tier Legendary Fruits: Blizzard (good PVP potential, rivals Buddah in grinding). B+ Tier Legendary Fruits: Quake (huge hitbox, excellent in PVP and bounty hunting). B Tier Legendary Fruits: Sound (good AoE, high damage, good grinding capabilities), Rumble (great PVP potential if used correctly). C+ Tier Legendary Fruits: Love (mostly AoE moves, some support, and some mobility), Phoenix (the awakened form is great with air camping abilities, great PVP & grinding potential). C Tier Legendary Fruits: Spider (can be decent if used correctly). D Tier Legendary Fruits: Pain (long range, not the best). A Tier Rare Fruits: Magma (good, all-around fruit) C Tier Rare Fruits: Ghost (good for grinding and PVP, originally called Revive). [2] X Research source
